entities.name: hearing
entities.description: Hearing is the sense that allows organisms to detect and interpret sound waves.

entities.name: AMYGDALA
entities.description: A brain region involved in the processing of emotions and enhancing memory encoding, particularly for emotionally charged events.|

entities.name: memories
entities.description: The formation, storage, and retrieval of information in the brain.

entities.name: memory disorders
entities.description: Memory disorders are conditions that affect the ability to form, retain, and recall memories. They can be caused by various factors including neurological damage, aging, and other medical conditions.

attributes.Causes: Neurological damage, aging, and other medical conditions
attributes.Impact on Cognitive Processes: Affect the ability to form, retain, and recall memories

entities.name: touch
entities.description: Touch is one of the five primary senses, which involves the perception of external stimuli through physical contact with the skin.

attributes.Function: Perception of Physical Contact and Texture

entities.name: smell
entities.description: Smell, also known as olfaction, is one of the five primary senses that allows organisms to detect and identify chemical substances in the environment.

entities.name: retrieval
entities.description: The dynamic process of accessing and bringing stored information to mind.

entities.name: PREFRONTAL CORTEX
entities.description: A brain region involved in the processing of sensory information and memory formation, contributing to decision-making and the regulation of complex cognitive behavior.|

entities.name: CEREBELLUM
entities.description: A brain region involved in the storage of procedural memories, which are related to skills and habits.|

entities.name: brain
entities.description: The brain is the central organ of the nervous system and plays a crucial role in processing sensory information.

entities.name: long-term potentiation
entities.description: A mechanism that strengthens synaptic connections over time.

entities.name: episodic memories
entities.description: Episodic memories are related to specific events and experiences, often better remembered due to the activation of the amygdala and other limbic structures that enhance memory encoding.

attributes.Enhancement Mechanism: Activation of Amygdala and Limbic Structures

entities.name: storage
entities.description: Maintaining and retaining information over time.

entities.name: senses
entities.description: Senses are physiological capacities of organisms that provide data for perception. The senses and their operation, classification, and theory are overlapping topics studied by cognitive sciences, psychology, neuroscience, and physiology.

entities.name: stages of sleep
entities.description: Distinct phases of sleep that occur cyclically and are crucial for various physiological processes, including memory consolidation.

entities.name: Brain Activity
entities.description: Brain activity refers to the electrical and metabolic processes that occur in the brain.

entities.name: SLEEP
entities.description: A state of rest that plays a vital role in memory consolidation, with different stages of sleep involved in the processing and strengthening of memories.|

entities.name: decision-making
entities.description: The cognitive process by which individuals evaluate information and options to make choices.

entities.name: retrieval mechanisms
entities.description: The process by which stored information is accessed and brought into conscious awareness.

entities.name: Neurons
entities.description: The basic functional units of the nervous system, responsible for transmitting information throughout the body.

entities.name: taste
entities.description: Taste is one of the five primary senses, responsible for detecting flavors and chemical substances in food and other materials.

entities.name: well-being
entities.description: Well-being encompasses an individual's physical, emotional, mental, and social health, contributing to their quality of life.

entities.name: Emotion
entities.description: Emotion refers to a complex state of feeling that results in physical and psychological changes.

entities.name: synaptic plasticity
entities.description: Synaptic plasticity is the modification of synaptic connections in response to experience and learning.

entities.name: Neural Networks
entities.description: Neural networks are interconnected groups of neurons that work together to process and transmit information.

entities.name: synapses
entities.description: Synapses are points of contact between neurons where signals are transmitted.

entities.name: research
entities.description: Systematic investigation into memory formation using advanced techniques.

entities.name: navigating the world
entities.description: The ability to use knowledge and experience to understand and move through one's environment effectively.

entities.name: memory traces
entities.description: Memory traces are modifications in neural connections that represent stored information.

entities.name: daily functioning
entities.description: The routine activities and tasks performed on a daily basis.

entities.name: encoding
entities.description: Converting sensory information into a form that can be stored in the brain.
